Thank You for fast sharing!

I chose to cut title 7 (playtime 58:03) - The rest including all menus will fit uncompressed on a DVD5 disc. You may want to burn title 7 with the tecnical background stuff, history, and explanations on its own disc.

Navigating the DVE disc:

* Press Menu button on the DVD remote
* Program Menu
* Program Guide
* Reference materials
* Press forward triangle ?>? in the far down right corner to access video test patterns (the triangle ? not the text)
* Choose title No 12 Display Setup Patterns

Calibration procedure
Preparation

* Set picture to ?normal? mode.
* Switch off any system for auto contrast adjustment (Dynamic Contrast/Samsung or OPC/SHARP)
* Choose picture mode ?custom? or ?user?

1. Adjust contrast using test picture title 12, chapter 14
* Adjust contrast VERY high
* Adjust down until the brightest step (top left/bottom right) is JUST visible.

2. Adjust brightness using test picture title 12, chapter 9
* Blacker than black bar must be just visible (if possible)
* Difference between the three black bars must be just visible (otherwise contrast may be too high)

3. Adjust sharpness using test picture title 12, chapter 17
* Turn sharpness all the way up
* Turn down slowly until white ?shadows? next to vertical black lines disappear

4. Adjust color balance using the enclosed color filter title 12, chapter 6
* Adjust color level for best COMPROMIZE
* Check if WARM/COLD picture ?temperature? adjustment gives better balance on all three colors.

5. Start all over again ? from point 1.
De-interlacing and scaling check
Follow above procedure but choose in stead title No 16 called 1.78:1 Motion patterns (by selecting forward triangle ?>? in the far down right corner twice).

1. Title 16, chapter 2:
* Look carefully at the round circle moving in the middle of the picture.
* In the perfect world the circle should look exactly the same when moving and when standing still.
* Toggle between alternative scaling resolutions and video set-up options on the DVD player. Choose the set-up that gives the reproduction of the moving circle that is least distorted (comparing to the circle when standing still).
